linkPattern.markdownDescription:
A RegExp used to find text in the document to turn into links. 

Example: `(ISSUES-\d+)`

The example pattern would match text like `ISSUE-1` and `ISSUE-200`. Brackets go around any part of the pattern that will be needed to construct the final link URL.

linkTarget.markdownDescription:
The link template.

Example: `https://myorg.atlassian.net/browse/$1`

In the example, `$1` will be replaced with the captured text from the linkPattern; the final URL might be `https://myorg.atlassian.net/browse/ISSUE-200`.

filePattern.markdownDescription:
A [glob pattern](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#GlobPattern) of files to enable this rule for.

Example: `**/*.{md,txt}`

In the example the rule is only for Markdown and plain text files. By default, the rule is enabled for all files.

patternlinks.rules.markdownDescription: a list of rules for turning text into clickable links.
